docs.lead_paragraph: “Fire at Sea” chronicles refugees’ horror and hope on a Mediterranean island. And “Vice” looks at transgender youths who opt to transition pre-puberty.

headline.main: What’s on TV Friday: ‘Fire at Sea’ and ‘Vice: Trans Youth’

docs.snippet: “Fire at Sea” chronicles refugees’ horror and hope on a Mediterranean island. And “Vice” looks at transgender youths who opt to transition pre-puberty....

docs.lead_paragraph: The president of the film academy has sent an email to its members telling them they have much to be proud of after this year's Oscars ceremony, and reassuring them changes will be made to avoid a repeat of problems like the botched best-picture announcement that closed the show.

headline.main: Film Academy President Reassures Members After Oscar Botch

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Chelsea midfielder Dennis Wise has likened N'Golo Kante to club great Claude Makelele and said the 25-year-old's stellar performance is one of the reasons the London side appear to be cruising towards the Premier League title.

headline.main: 'Unsung Hero' Kante Pushing Chelsea Towards Title-Wise

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's smaller companies are hoarding cash and cutting investment, bankers say, a sign of business confidence starting to wobble as the government sets off down the uncertain path of leaving the European Union.

docs.lead_paragraph: Beijing's escalating condemnation of South Korea over a U.S. anti-missile system has triggered protests against a popular retail giant and a reported ban on Chinese tour groups visiting the country, apparent signs that Beijing plans to make Seoul pay an economic price over a move that China says threatens its security.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pittsburgh Pirate third baseman Kang Jung-ho was handed a suspended prison sentence for drunk driving in his native South Korea on Friday, the Seoul Central District Court confirmed, clearing him to join his team for Spring Training.
